summary: This bill, the National Rosie the Riveter Day Act, proposes to designate March 21st as National Rosie the Riveter Day. It requests the President to issue an annual proclamation calling on the public to observe the day with appropriate ceremonies and activities, recognizing the contributions of women who joined the workforce during World War II. The bill highlights the sacrifices and achievements of these women, aiming to preserve their legacy and promote patriotism.
